org.apache.flex.abc.instructionlist

Class InstructionList

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.flex.abc.instructionlist.InstructionList
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Cloneable

    public class InstructionList
extends Object
implements Cloneable
    An InstructionList is a structure that holds a sequence of Instructions, and manages sets of labels, which act as relocatable address constants, to compose control-flow constructs from their constituent parts.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static interface  InstructionList.IFilter
      Interface used by code-gen clients that need a chance to adjust the instruction list after it is generated.

      • firstElement

        public Instruction firstElement()
        Returns:
        the first Instruction in this list.
        Throws:
        NoSuchElementException - if there are no instructions.

      • lastElement

        public Instruction lastElement()
        Returns:
        the last element found.
        Throws:
        NoSuchElementException - if there are no instructions.

      • isEmpty

        public boolean isEmpty()
        Returns:
        true if no Instructions are found.

      • getInstructions

        public ArrayList<Instruction> getInstructions()
        Fetch an InstructionList to which instructions can be appended. Synthesizes one if not already present.
        Returns:
        said list.

      • getLabel

        public Label getLabel()
        Fetch this InstructionList's label.
        Returns:
        a synthetic Label that identifies this InstructionList.

              int pos)
        Add a label at an arbitrary position.
        Parameters:
        l - - the label.
        pos - - the label's position.

      • getActiveLabels

        public ArrayList<Label> getActiveLabels()
        Returns:
        this InstructionList's active labels (i.e., labels resolved to a known offset within this InstructionList).

      • getLastLabel

        public Label getLastLabel()
        Returns:
        a Label bound to the last position in this InstructionList.

      • labelNext

        public void labelNext(Label l)
        Add a Label to this InstructionList's pendingLabels.
        Parameters:
        l - - the Label to be set pending.

      • size

        public int size()
        Returns:
        the size of this InstructionList; zero if the list has no instructions, or the number of instructions.

      • hasPendingLabels

        public boolean hasPendingLabels()
        Returns:
        true if this InstructionList has unresolved pending labels.

      • stripPendingLabels

        public Collection<Label> stripPendingLabels()
        This InstructionList is the "body" of a statement that needs to add more logic. Any pending labels from the body statement(s) need to be re-assigned to the owning InstructionList at a later time.
        Returns:
        this list's [former] pendingLabels.

      • addAllPendingLabels

        public void addAllPendingLabels(Collection<Label> prev_pending)
        Add pending labels acquired from a component list to this list's pendingLabels collection.
        Parameters:
        prev_pending - - pending labels returned by a call to stripPendingLabels().

      • canFallThrough

        public boolean canFallThrough()
        Returns:
        true if the given InstructionList does not have an unconditional transfer of control as its last instruction.

      • toString

        public String toString()
        Format the InstructionList for debugging purposes.
        Overrides:
        toString in class Object

      • clone

        public Object clone()
        Clone this InstructionList; make a shallow copy of the Instructions, deep copies of the labels.
        Overrides:
        clone in class Object
        Returns:
        a cloned InstructionList.

      • hasSuchInstruction

        public boolean hasSuchInstruction(int opcode)
        Search for an Instruction with a specific opcode.
        Parameters:
        opcode - - the opcode of interest.
        Returns:
        true if an instruction with this opcode is part of this InstructionList.

      • countOccurrences

        public int countOccurrences(int opcode)
        Count occurrences of an Instruction with a specific opcode.
        Parameters:
        opcode - - the opcode of interest.
        Returns:
        the count of occurrences.

      • findOccurrences

        public int findOccurrences(int opcode,
                  boolean stop_after_first)
        Find occurrences of an Instruction with a specific opcode.
        Parameters:
        opcode - - the opcode of interest.
        stop_after_first - - return a nonzero count after finding at least one occurence (1-3 occurences in the fixed storage, the first occurence in variable storage).
        Returns:
        the count of occurrences, or 0/1/2/3 if stop_after_first is set.

      • pushNumericConstant

        public void pushNumericConstant(long value)
        Add an Instruction to this InstructionList to push a numeric constant onto the value stack.
        Parameters:
        value - - the value to push.
